content.description:
A GRAPHING CALCULATOR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS QUESTION.

You are permitted to use your calculator to solve an equation, find the derivative of a function at a point, or calculate the value of a definite integral. However, you must clearly indicate the setup of your question, namely the equation, function, or integral you are using. If you use other built-in features or programs, you must show the mathematical steps necessary to produce your results. Your work must be expressed in standard mathematical notation rather than calculator syntax.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

The function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, 3 times, open parenthesis, 1 plus x, close parenthesis, raised to the 0.5 power, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction with the numerator pi times x, and the denominator 6, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous and decreasing for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with <math alttext="g of 3 equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The figure above on the left shows the graphs of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the regions <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the region bounded by the graph of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>- and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axes. Region <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has area <math alttext="3.24125" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.24125</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the region bounded by the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis and the graphs of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The figure above on the right shows the graph of <math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, g of x, close parenthesis, squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the region <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the region bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, open parenthesis, g of x, close parenthesis, squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>- and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axes. Region <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has area <math alttext="5.32021" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>5.32021</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: (a) Find the area of region <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Find the area of region <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

(b) Find the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals negative 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Region <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the base of a solid. For this solid, each cross section perpendicular to the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is a rectangle whose height is <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> times the length of its base in region <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression for the volume of this solid.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
